<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Break" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>Contractor shall have the right to terminate its efforts to improve the performance of the Unit and pay the applicable Net Unit Electrical Output Liquidated Damages. If Contractor has previously paid Net Unit Electrical Output Liquidated Damages and, as a result of Contractor&#146;s efforts, as of the end of the Correction Period (or such earlier time as the Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee has been met or Contractor has determined that further repairs, replacements, adjustments or modifications to improve performance are not practicable), the Unit is able to meet the Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee or Contractor has been able to increase the Net Unit Electrical Output from the level at which the Net Unit Electrical Output Liquidated Damages were previously paid, in each case as demonstrated by a Net Unit Electrical Output Test, Contractor shall be entitled to a refund of all or
the applicable portion of the Net Unit Electrical Output Liquidated Damages paid by Contractor, calculated as provided in Section 13.3.  Amounts expended by Contractor in its efforts to meet the Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee shall not limit or affect Contractor&#146;s obligation to pay Net Unit Electrical Output Liquidated Damages.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee is subject to the conditions stated in Section 14.6(c) and to the following: </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.33in; text-indent:2in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(A)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Owners have provided access to the electrical grid and sufficient electrical load to perform the test.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.33in; text-indent:2in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(B)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee shall be demonstrated by the Net Unit Electrical Output Test to be conducted at the times set forth in Section 11.5(c)(ii) and subject to measurement and adjustment based on the Reference Conditions and other conditions and requirements set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit L</font></u><font size=2>.  </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.33in; text-indent:2in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(C)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Necessary auxiliary equipment for producing the Net Unit Electrical Output shall include only the Equipment loads provided in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit L</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.33in; text-indent:2in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(D)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Completion of the Net Unit Electrical Output Test or re-test that demonstrates the achievement of the Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee or the payment of the Net Unit Electrical Output Liquidated Damages to Owners shall relieve Contractor of any further obligation with respect to the Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee.</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="197" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="96" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(b)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="53" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>[***]</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:0.8in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Moisture Carryover Guarantee</font></u><font size=2>.  Contractor guarantees, subject to the provisions of this Agreement and in accordance with the Operation and Maintenance Manuals, that each Unit, when completed and loaded with Nuclear Fuel, will be capable of producing steam with a Moisture Carryover limit of [***] at the exit of the steam generator dryers and prior to entering the flow limiting nozzles (the &#147;Moisture Carryover Guarantee&#148;).  The maximum amount of Moisture Carryover shall be [***] at the exit of the steam generator dryers and prior to entering the flow limiting nozzles (the &#147;Maximum Moisture Carryover Amount&#148;).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Footer">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font SIZE=2></font></p>
&nbsp;

<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="352" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="293" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="59" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><A NAME="PAGENUM"><font size=2>64</font></A></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'>&nbsp;</p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'></p>
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Break" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.05in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the calculated Moisture Carryover is greater than the Moisture Carryover Guarantee as of the Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date of a Unit due to Contractor&#146;s or its Personnel&#146;s acts or omissions, Contractor shall, at its sole option, [***].</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.05in;text-align:left;'><font size=2> (ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Moisture Carryover Guarantee is based upon the Unit operating at the conditions set forth in the AP1000 Nuclear Power Plant Start-up Test Procedure for the Moisture Carryover Test.  </font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="245" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="144" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(iii)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="53" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>[***]</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:0.8in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Contractor Burden of Proof</font></u><font size=2>.  Contractor shall bear the burden of proving that a failure to meet the Net Unit Electrical Output Guarantee, [***] or Moisture Carryover Guarantee was not due to an act or omission of Contractor or its Personnel.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><B><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE 12</font></B></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><B><font SIZE=2>STAGES OF COMPLETION</font></B></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="197" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="67" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in; '><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>12.1</font></p> </td>
        <td width="83" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Turnover</font></u><font size=2>.  &nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Sequential Turnover</font></u><font size=2>.  Turnover refers to the sequential mechanical completion of each system and structure of a Unit.  &#147;Turnover&#148; of a system or structure shall occur upon the satisfaction of the following conditions:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such system or structure (and components thereof) shall be physically completed in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement, the COL, and applicable Industry Codes and Standards (except for Punch-List items) and Law; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The systems comprising such system or structure shall have been checked for alignment, lubrication, rotation and electrical continuity and hydrostatic and pneumatic pressure integrity;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such system or structure (and components thereof) shall have been flushed and cleaned out and shall be ready to support the commencement of the Preoperational Tests;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Construction and Installation Tests and Preoperational Tests of such system or structure shall have been satisfactorily completed;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Structures or portions thereof shall be completed, necessary coatings applied and the area cleaned;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Applicable ITAAC for the system or structure (and components thereof) shall have been met in accordance with ITAAC procedures to be developed by mutual agreement of Contractor and Owners, including a requirement to demonstrate that an ITAAC previously met for such system or structure (or components thereof) has not been compromised since initial satisfaction; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Footer">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font SIZE=2></font></p>
&nbsp;

<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="352" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="293" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="59" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><A NAME="PAGENUM"><font size=2>65</font></A></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'>&nbsp;</p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'></p>
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Break" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(vii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Turnover Package for the system or structure (and any components thereof), including without limitation applicable Documentation for the system or structure, shall have been delivered to Owners.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Notice and Acceptance of Turnover</font></u><font size=2>.  When Contractor believes the provisions of Section 12.1(a) have been satisfied with respect to each system or structure, Contractor shall deliver a written notice of such determination through the Joint Test Working Group to Owners with sufficient detail to enable Owners to determine whether Contractor has achieved such requirements. Owners shall accept such system or structure as having achieved Turnover, by delivering to Contractor notice of that acceptance within [***] following receipt of Contractor&#146;s notice that Turnover has occurred; alternatively, Owners may disagree that Turnover has occurred by notifying Contractor in writing of why they disagree that Turnover of such system or structure has occurred, in which case (and without
prejudice to Contractor&#146;s right to submit a Claim) Contractor shall take such corrective actions as are necessary and resubmit its written notice of determination to Owners in accordance with this Section 12.1(b). If no notice is issued by Owners within the required time period, Owners will be deemed to have accepted that Turnover of such system or structure has occurred; provided, however, that in the event more than [***] are delivered to Owners within [***], for each additional Turnover Package delivered to Owners within such [***], Owners shall receive an incremental [***] to review such Turnover Package [***].  The date of Turnover for a system or structure shall be the date of Owners&#146; acceptance or deemed acceptance of Contractor&#146;s notice in accordance with the procedures in this Section 12.1(b). Upon Turnover of a system or structure, Contractor shall turn over risk of loss and care, custody, control and operation of such system, structure or component to Owners
in accordance with Section 21.2.  </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.19in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>12.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Unit Mechanical Completion</font></u><font size=2>.  &#147;Unit Mechanical Completion&#148; shall be achieved for a Unit when the final system or structure of such Unit needed for the commencement of the Start-Up Tests for the Unit has achieved Turnover in accordance with Section 12.1. When submitting its written notice of determination under Section 12.1(b) for such final system or structure, Contractor shall include notice that Unit Mechanical Completion will occur upon the Turnover of such system or structure.  </font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="301" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="67" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>12.3</font></p> </td>
        <td width="187" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Start-up Test Completion</font></u><font size=2>.  &nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Start-up Test Completion&#148; for a Unit shall be deemed to have occurred upon satisfactory completion of the Start-up Test for the Unit or, in the circumstances specified in Section 11.4(c)(iv), upon deemed completion of the Start-up Test.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor shall notify Owners when the provisions of Section 12.3(a) have been satisfied.  Owners shall accept such Unit as having achieved Start-up Test Completion, by delivering to Contractor notice of that acceptance within [***] following receipt of Contractor&#146;s notice that Start-up Test Completion has occurred; alternatively, Owners may disagree that Start-up Test Completion has occurred by notifying Contractor in writing of why they disagree that Start-up Test Completion has occurred.  If no notice is issued by Owners within the required time period, Owners will be deemed to have accepted that Start-up Test Completion has occurred.  The date of Start-up Test Completion shall be </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Footer">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font SIZE=2></font></p>
&nbsp;

<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="352" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="293" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="59" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><A NAME="PAGENUM"><font size=2>66</font></A></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'>&nbsp;</p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'></p>
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Break" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>the date the Unit has achieved Start-up Test Completion and not the date of Owners&#146; acceptance.  </font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="288" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="67" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in;page-break-after:avoid'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>12.4</font></p> </td>
        <td width="173" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Substantial Completion</font></u><font size=2>.  &nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Substantial Completion&#148; of a Unit shall be deemed to have occurred upon:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;achievement of Unit Mechanical Completion, Preoperational Test Completion in accordance with Section 11.3 and Start-up Test Completion in accordance with Section 11.4 or, in the circumstances specified in Section 11.4(c)(iv), upon deemed completion of the Start-up Test;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;achievement of the [***] or, in the circumstances specified in Section 11.5(d)(iv), upon deemed completion of the Performance Tests;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) achievement of the Performance Guarantees for the Unit or the payment of applicable Performance Liquidated Damages by Contractor or (B) Owners have placed the Unit into commercial operation (provided that such action shall not negate Contractor&#146;s obligation to pay Performance Liquidated Damages) or (C) in the circumstances specified in Section 11.5(d)(iv), upon deemed completion of the Performance Tests;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor has caused the Work on such Unit and associated portions of the Site (to the extent required as in the case of Section 3.5(m)(ii)) to be completed except for Punch List items pursuant to the terms hereof; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor has delivered the interim lien waivers and releases required pursuant to Section 8.9(a)(i), as well as proof of satisfaction or bonding of all liens; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor has delivered certificates of occupancy and all remaining Documentation other than such Documentation to be delivered upon Final Completion.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Notice and Acceptance of Substantial Completion</font></u><font size=2>.  When Contractor believes the provisions of Section 12.4(a) have been satisfied, Contractor shall deliver to Owners a written notice of such determination with sufficient detail to enable Owners to determine whether Contractor has achieved such requirements.  Owners shall accept such Unit as having achieved Substantial Completion, by delivering to Contractor notice of that acceptance within [***] following receipt of Contractor&#146;s certification that Substantial Completion has occurred or by notifying Contractor in writing of why it disagrees that Substantial Completion has occurred.  If no notice is delivered by Owners within such [***], Substantial Completion will be deemed to have occurred as of the date of Contractor&#146;s
notice.  If Owners notify Contractor that such requirements have not been met, Contractor will promptly undertake such action or work as necessary to achieve such requirements and shall then issue another written certification of Substantial Completion to Owners stating that Contractor believes such requirements have been achieved.  Such procedure shall be repeated </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Footer">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font SIZE=2></font></p>
&nbsp;

<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="352" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="293" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="59" nowrap valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><A NAME="PAGENUM"><font size=2>67</font></A></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'>&nbsp;</p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'></p>
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Break" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>until Substantial Completion is achieved.  Upon Owners&#146; acceptance or deemed acceptance of a Unit having achieved Substantial Completion, the date of Substantial Completion shall be the date of Contractor&#146;s most recent written certification of satisfaction of the Substantial Completion requirements. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.19in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>12.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Punch List</font></u><font size=2>.  Prior to Substantial Completion of a Unit, Contractor shall submit to Owners for their review and approval a comprehensive list of remaining Work, which shall be of a minor nature and not prevent commercial operation of the Unit (the &#147;Punch List&#148;).  Owners will review the Punch List and provide Contractor with comments thereto and/or approval thereof within [***] from the date of submission of the Punch List to Owners.  Owners shall have the right to withhold the Punch-List Withholding Amount from the payment due upon Substantial Completion of the Unit, which amount shall be released to Contractor in accordance with Section 8.9(d).</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="251" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="67" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>12.6</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Final Completion</font></u><font size=2>.  &nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>



<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="633" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="124" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>

        <td width="44" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(a)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="465" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>&#147;Final Completion&#148; of a Unit shall be deemed to have occurred upon:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>



<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="616" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="196" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="44" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(i)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="376" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>the Unit&#146;s achievement of Substantial Completion;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the completion of the Punch List items in accordance with this Agreement; </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor has delivered all lien waivers and releases and Contractor Affidavit required pursuant to Section 8.9(a)(ii), as well as proof of satisfaction or bonding of all liens;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor has assigned Subcontractor and Vendor warranties as required pursuant to Section 3.5(u)(vii); and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the delivery to Owners of the remaining Documentation, including without limitation copies of any Subcontracts required to be delivered pursuant to Section 3.5(u)(vii).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When Contractor believes the provisions of Section 12.6(a) have been satisfied, Contractor shall deliver to Owners a written notice of such determination with sufficient detail to enable Owners to determine whether Contractor has achieved such requirements. Owners shall accept the Unit as having achieved Final Completion, by delivering to Contractor notice of that acceptance within [***] following receipt of Contractor&#146;s certification that Final Completion has occurred or by notifying Contractor in writing of why it disagrees that Final Completion has occurred. If no notice is delivered by Owners, Final Completion will be deemed to have occurred as of the date of Contractor&#146;s notice.  If Owners notify Contractor that such requirements have not been met, Contractor will promptly undertake such action or work as
necessary to achieve such requirements and shall then issue another written certification of Final Completion to Owners stating that Contractor believes such requirements have been achieved.  Such procedure shall be repeated until Final Completion is achieved.  Upon Owners&#146; acceptance or deemed acceptance of a Unit having achieved Final Completion, the date of Final Completion shall be the date of </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that Contractor is unable to achieve Final Completion of a Unit within [***] following Substantial Completion of the Unit [***] due to the fact that Owners limit Contractor&#146;s access to the Facility or otherwise do not allow Contractor to take the necessary actions to achieve Final Completion, then as of such date, Contractor shall be paid for all amounts that would be due upon Final Completion for completed Work, but in no event shall Contractor be paid for Work that is not completed.  Contractor shall complete the Work at such time as Owners provide access to the Facility or allow the necessary actions to take place. In the event that the delay in completion of the Work results in increased costs for Contractor, such delay shall constitute a Change and shall entitle Contractor to seek a Change Order
pursuant to Article 9 for such increased costs.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><B><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE 13</font></B></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font size=2>DELAY AND PERFORMANCE GUARANTEES; BONUSES</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.19in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>13.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Delay Liquidated Damages</font></u><font size=2>.  The Parties agree that it would be extremely difficult and impracticable under presently known and anticipated facts and circumstances to ascertain and fix the actual damages Owners would incur if a Unit does not achieve Substantial Completion by the Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date for such Unit and, accordingly, if a Unit does not achieve Substantial Completion by such Unit&#146;s Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date, as such date may be extended pursuant to this Agreement, Owners&#146; remedy for such delay shall be to recover from Contractor as liquidated damages, and not as a penalty, liquidated damages (&#147;Delay Liquidated Damages&#148;) as follows:</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="149" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="96" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0in'><font size=2>[***]</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>The amount of proceeds to which Owners are entitled on a daily basis pursuant to the delay in start-up insurance coverage (following the deductible period thereunder) shall, if procured pursuant to Section 16.3, reduce the Delay Liquidated Damages due from Contractor for each Day for which such insurance is payable; provided that in the event the daily amount of such insurance proceeds exceed the daily Delay Liquidated Damages, Contractor shall have no claim to such excess.  Beginning with the date that [***].   </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>In no event shall the total Delay Liquidated Damages for the failure to achieve Substantial Completion of a Unit on or prior to the Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date for such Unit exceed in the aggregate an amount equal to [***].  Payment of the Delay Liquidated Damages shall be Owners&#146; sole and exclusive remedy for Contractor&#146;s failure to achieve Substantial Completion of a Unit on or before the Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date for such Unit; however, Delay Liquidated Damages are intended only to cover damages suffered by Owners as a result of delay and shall not affect the right of Owners to terminate the Agreement pursuant to Article 22 or their remedies provided for in Article 22 as a result of such termination.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.19in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>13.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Early Completion Bonus. &nbsp;</font></u><font size=2>In the event Substantial Completion of a Unit occurs prior to the Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date for such Unit, then Owners shall pay to </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.12in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>13.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Performance Bonus. &nbsp;</font></u><font size=2>Following Substantial Completion of a Unit [***] the Net Unit Electrical Output will be measured to determine an average Net Unit Electrical Output for such Unit.  [***].</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.19in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>13.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Payment</font></u><font size=2>.  The Delay Liquidated Damages and Performance Liquidated Damages, if due, shall be due and payable by Contractor to Owners within [***] following receipt of a written statement from Owners that such amounts are due. The Early Completion Bonus, if due for a Unit, shall be paid within [***] following the Guaranteed Substantial Completion Date for such Unit.  The Performance Bonus, if due for a Unit, shall be paid within [***].  If the payment of any such amount is disputed, then the Party owing money to the other Party shall pay [***] of such disputed amounts pending resolution of such dispute in accordance with Article 27.  Once the dispute is resolved, the additional amount due, if any, shall be paid, or the excess amount paid, if any, shall be refunded, by the applicable Party,
within [***] after the date of the final resolution, together with [***].</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><B><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE 14</font></B></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><B><font SIZE=2>WARRANTY</font></B></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="208" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="67" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>14.1</font></p> </td>
        <td width="93" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Equipment</font></u><font size=2>.  &nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Equipment Warranty</font></u><font size=2>.  Contractor warrants that the Equipment furnished hereunder, including the Units and the systems and structures associated therewith, will be: [***]; provided, however, that to the extent an Extended Equipment Warranty Period for such Equipment is provided pursuant to </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit T</font></u><font size=2>, such Extended Equipment Warranty Period shall be subject to the terms of such Warranty set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit T</font></u><font size=2>. The Equipment Warranty does not apply to the expected, routine (i.e., a frequency typical in industry experience) replacement of consumables such as, but not limited to, gaskets, seals, filters, electronic tubes, packing, fuses, transistors and light bulbs.  Contractor shall deliver
to Owners </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit T</font></u><font size=2> for Owners&#146; review and approval no later than [***]. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Equipment Warranty Remedy</font></u><font size=2>.  If Owners discover that any Equipment is non-conforming or fails during the Equipment Warranty Period as provided in Section 14.3(a), Owners shall, within the Equipment Warranty Period, promptly notify Contractor of such non-conformance or failure along with evidence which reasonably demonstrates Contractor&#146;s responsibility therefor.  Upon receipt of such notice, Contractor shall: (i) repair, replace, redesign, modify or adjust Equipment, structures or components as required to cure such non-conformance or failure; [***]; and (iv) perform such tests as are reasonably necessary to demonstrate the cure of such nonconformance, failure, loss or damage. [***]. For the above losses or damages which are covered under Owners&#146; insurance coverages, (a)
the amount equal to the difference between Contractor&#146;s Deductible Portion and the applicable insurance deductible plus (b) the cost necessary to repair or replace such losses or damages that are in excess of such insurance coverages or not otherwise reimbursed by such coverages (unless due to the Insurance Exclusions), shall constitute a Change and entitle Contractor to seek a Change Order pursuant to Article 9.  Contractor will use reasonable efforts to perform the Warranty Work at a time responsive to and consistent with the Owners&#146; requirements for the safe, reliable and efficient operation of the Facility.  The </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Footer">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font SIZE=2></font></p>

        <td width="293" nowrap valign=top >

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>decision to repair, replace, redesign, modify or adjust will be made by Contractor with input from Owners.  [***] Should investigation by Contractor reveal that a defect or failure is not covered by the Equipment Warranty, Owners shall reimburse Contractor for the repair work undertaken by Contractor on a [***]. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Warranty Work Deferral</font></u><font size=2>.  At Owners&#146; option, Warranty Work may be deferred until the time of the Unit&#146;s next regularly scheduled refueling outage and the Warranty provisions hereunder shall apply notwithstanding that such outage occurs after the end of the Equipment Warranty Period.  If Contractor advises Owners that deferral of the Warranty Work can reasonably be expected to cause damage to the Unit and/or Equipment, Owners may elect to use the Unit and/or Equipment at their own risk and expense, without recourse against Contractor.   </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Additional Owners&#146; Obligations</font></u><font size=2>.  As long as any Equipment is subject to the Equipment Warranty or Services Warranty, Owners shall:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Afford Contractor an opportunity to review Owners&#146; system of developing and recording data related to Facility performance;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provide authorized personnel of Contractor and its Subcontractors and Vendors reasonable access to the Facility should Contractor decide to observe the manner in which the Facility is operated and maintained; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provide authorized personnel of Contractor and its Subcontractors and Vendors reasonable access to operation and maintenance records of Owners.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>Should the Owners not provide any of the foregoing, such action shall cause Contractor&#146;s obligations to terminate with respect to the particular claimed defect.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Working Access to Equipment and Plant Support Activities to be Provided by Owners</font></u><font size=2>.  The plant personnel and facilities to be provided by Owners in accordance with Section 14.1(b) are listed below. Owners shall also provide this support after Unit Mechanical Completion should Contractor be required to repair or replace Equipment after Unit Mechanical Completion but before the Warranty Period has commenced.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;operations support to establish the required plant conditions (i.e., operating mode) for the repairs;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;make the plant systems, structures, and components available and placed in the proper configuration;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide lay down area(s) for equipment storage, set-up, staging and operation. <p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xiii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide areas for storage of (A) low specific activity, and (B) clean equipment boxes and/or (C) Sealands. <p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xiv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;establish and maintain appropriate and acceptable radiological conditions in accordance with Laws, Prudent Practices, and Licensed Operator policy, including, but not limited to, any required decontamination to reasonable limits that will allow Contractor to perform its obligations under this Article 14, such that reasonably unencumbered access to the required work areas is enabled for all personnel;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide anti-contamination clothing, lockers, change area, dosimetry, health physics and radiation protection service and badging for Site access as typically required;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xvi)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide official whole body exposure data for Contractor&#146;s Personnel upon personnel departure from the site;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xvii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provide Gamma isotopic analysis to determine radioactivity of waste;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(xxviii)&nbsp;provide outside phone lines, sanitation facilities and drinking water.</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="188" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Services  &nbsp;</font></u></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Services Warranty</font></u><font size=2>. Contractor warrants that the services required as part of the Work will be performed in conformance with the requirements of this Agreement, including without limitation the Performance Standards (the &#147;Services Warranty&#148;). The Services Warranty and the Equipment Warranty are collectively the &#147;Warranties&#148;.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Services Warranty Remedy</font></u><font size=2>. If Owners discover that any portion of the Services required as part of the Work fails to comply with the Services Warranty, Owners shall, within the Services Warranty Period, promptly notify Contractor of such non-conformance along with evidence which reasonably demonstrates Contractor&#146;s responsibility therefor. Upon such notice, Contractor shall (i) promptly re-perform the non-conforming Services and any additional Work required under the Equipment Warranty, [***] and (iv) perform such tests as are reasonably necessary to demonstrate the cure of such nonconformance, failure, loss or damage. [***]  For the above losses or damages which are covered under Owners&#146; insurance coverages, (a) the amount equal to the difference between
Contractor&#146;s Deductible Portion and the applicable insurance deductible plus (b) the cost </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<div TITLE="EE+ Page Footer">

</DIV>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>necessary to repair or replace such losses or damages that are in excess of such insurance coverages or not otherwise reimbursed by such coverages (unless due to the Insurance Exclusions), shall constitute a Change and entitle Contractor to seek a Change Order pursuant to Article 9.  Contractor shall use reasonable efforts to perform the Warranty Work at a time responsive to and consistent with the Owners&#146; requirements for the safe, reliable and efficient operation of the Facility in accordance with Owners&#146; operational requirements and needs. At Owners&#146; option, Warranty Work may be deferred until the time of the Unit&#146;s next regularly scheduled refueling outage and the Warranty provisions hereunder shall apply notwithstanding that such outage occurs after the end of the Services Warranty Period. If Contractor advises Owners that deferral of the Warranty Work can
reasonably be expected to result in damage to the Unit and/or Equipment which occurs after Contractor&#146;s advice and results from deferral of such Warranty Work, Owners may elect to use the Unit and/or Equipment at their own risk and expense, without recourse against Contractor. The decision to repair, replace, redesign, modify or adjust will be made by Contractor with input from Owners. [***].  Should investigation by Contractor reveal that the non-conformance is not covered by the Services Warranty, Owners shall reimburse Contractor for the reperformance of the Work undertaken by Contractor on [***].</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="240" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="67" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>14.3</font></p> </td>
        <td width="125" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Warranty Period  &nbsp;</font></u></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>



<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="371" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="124" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="44" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(a)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="203" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Equipment Warranty Period</font></u><font size=2>.  </font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except for the Equipment listed in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit I</font></u><font size=2>, the Equipment Warranty for a Unit will commence upon [***] and will expire on the date that is [***] (the &#147;Standard Equipment Warranty Period&#148;); provided, however, that for those items of Equipment listed in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit T</font></u><font size=2>, an extended time period as set forth in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit T</font></u><font size=2> (the &#147;Extended Equipment Warranty Period&#148;) shall apply. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[***].  Upon the expiration of the applicable Equipment Warranty Period, all such Equipment Warranty obligations will terminate. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the Equipment listed in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit I</font></u><font size=2> which is placed into service prior to Substantial Completion, the Equipment Warranty will commence upon such date when an item in </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit I</font></u><font size=2> is placed into service and will expire on [***].  If, however, any such item of Equipment is placed into service prior to Substantial Completion of the applicable Unit for the sole purpose of being used by Contractor to support its performance of the Work, the Equipment Warranty will commence upon the Substantial Completion Date of such applicable Unit and will expire on the [***].  Contractor shall give notice to Owner within [***] after an item from </font><u><font size=2>Exhibit I</font></u><font size=2> has been placed into service.</font><i><b><font size=2>  </font></b></i></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Services Warranty Period</font></u><font size=2>.  The Services Warranty will be concurrent with the Standard Equipment Warranty Period (the &#147;Services Warranty Period&#148;). The Services Warranty Period, together with the Standard or Extended Equipment Warranty Period, as the case may be, are defined as the &#147;Warranty Period&#148;.  Upon the expiration of the Services Warranty Period, all such Services Warranty obligations will terminate.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Parties acknowledge that the Warranties are given by Contractor to Owners in addition to any Subcontractor and Vendor warranties that Contractor assigns to Owners pursuant to Section 3.5(u)(vii), and that the expiration of the Warranty Period is only applicable to the Warranties and will have no effect on any assigned Subcontractor and Vendor warranties that may be of longer duration; provided that Contractor shall have no responsibility or liability  for any assigned Subcontractor or Vendor warranties to the extent that they extend beyond the Warranty Periods following the date of such assignment.</font></p>


<div align=left>

</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Extension for Corrected Work</font></u><font size=2>.  Any Work re-performed and any part of the Facility that is reworked, repaired or replaced in satisfaction of Contractor&#146;s obligations in connection with the Warranties will be re-warranted by Contractor pursuant to the same Warranty set forth in Sections 14.1(a) and 14.2(a), and Contractor will have the same obligations in relation thereto as set forth in those Sections, for a period equal to the longer of: [***].</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Extension for Total Shutdown</font></u><font size=2>.  If, during the Standard Equipment Warranty Period, a Unit is shut down (other than for the purpose of scheduled or routine maintenance) and to the extent that such shutdown is due to a non-conformance covered by the Warranties, [***].</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.19in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>14.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Warranty of Title</font></u><font size=2>.  Contractor represents and warrants that the Work and the Equipment furnished by it and its Vendors that become part of the Facility or are otherwise furnished to Owners shall be legally and beneficially owned by Owners free from any Liens (other than Liens created by the actions of Owners, including non-payment).</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="319" style='border-collapse:collapse; '>

</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE WARRANTIES AND REMEDIES SET FORTH IN THIS ARTICLE 14 FOR ANY NON-CONFORMANCE OF EQUIPMENT OR SERVICES ARE THE EXCLUSIVE WARRANTIES AND REMEDIES FOR SUCH NON-CONFORMANCE OF EQUIPMENT OR SERVICES AND ARE IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES AND REMEDIES FOR SUCH NON-CONFORMANCE OF EQUIPMENT OR SERVICES WHETHER STATUTORY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED (INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND WARRANTIES ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE IN TRADE) AND WHETHER CLAIMS BY OWNERS ARE BASED IN CONTRACT, IN TORT (INCLUDING FAULT, NEGLIGENCE OR STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Article 14, Contractor shall have no liability hereunder for non-conformance of Equipment or material or performance, to the extent that it results, in whole or in part, from any of the following and </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>is not attributable to any acts or omissions of Contractor, its Subcontractors or Vendors or the Personnel of any of them:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operation of the Facility outside of the Design Bases of the Equipment or integrated system;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use, handling, storage, operation or maintenance of the Equipment or material therein in violation of manufacturer&#146;s written instructions (provided that such instructions have been delivered to Owners) or Prudent Practices or operation outside the guidelines of the Specifications following Turnover of a system or structure;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Alteration, abuse or misuse of the Equipment unless such alteration is approved by Contractor;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any operation or maintenance of the Equipment that is not in accordance with either of the Operating Procedures or Maintenance Procedures;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operation or maintenance by personnel not qualified in accordance with Southern Nuclear's standard qualification requirements for operating or maintenance personnel; or</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use of Nuclear Fuel in the Unit that is not designed and fabricated by Westinghouse.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractor shall be relieved from fulfilling its Warranty obligations as specified in this Article 14 to the extent that:</font></p>


<div align=left>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="459" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="192" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p  style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent: 0in'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>(i)</font></p> </td>
        <td width="219" nowrap valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in; '>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A Nuclear Incident occurs, and</font></p> </td> </tr></table>
</div>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:1.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2> (ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the consequences, including radiation, of such Nuclear Incident prevent Contractor from performing such Warranty obligations; provided, however, that Contractor shall be obligated to fulfill such Warranty obligations at such time as Contractor or its Personnel are permitted to enter the work area pursuant to applicable Law.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In any action taken by Contractor to satisfy a claim by Owners under any of the Warranties specified herein, Contractor shall be entitled to whatever financial relief is provided by the insurers pursuant to Owners&#146; insurance policies with respect to loss or damage caused by the breach of any such Warranty.</font><i><b><font size=2>  </font></b></i></p>
